data.title: June Iteration Plan
data.body:
This plan captures what we **work on during June** and will **ship early July**.

We arrived at the following themes for June:
- Remove the most requested adoption blockers.
- Make the repository with the Monaco/standalone editor available.
- Improve the getting started experience

The [June Test Plan items](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3Atestplan-item+milestone%3A%22June+2016%22) are created as issues get closed.

For more information about our development process please refer to the development process [page](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process).
### Schedule
- June 27 Code freeze for the endgame June
- June 29 Endgame done

End game dates (we end an iteration with an [endgame](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process#end-game))
##### Monday, Jun 27
- [x] Code freeze at end of day
##### Tuesday, Jun 28
- [x] Test plan input done at 8am Zurich time
- [x] Test plan ready
- [x] Test build done
- [x] Testing
##### Wednesday, Jun 29
- [x] Testing
- [x] Fixing
##### Thursday, Jun 30
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Run OSS tool
- [x] Verification
- [x] Update release notes
##### Friday, Jul 1
- [x] Add shrink-wrap files
- [x] Run OSS tool after merging shrinkwrap findings - @weinand
  - [x] Check new OSS usage is entered into the tool - @kieferrm
- [x] Fixing (only critical bugs)
- [x] Translation input - @dbaeumer 
- [Smoketest](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test)
  - [x] Windows -  @ramya-rao-a
  - [x] OS X - @chrmarti 
  - [x] Linux - @Tyriar
- [x] All release notes updated 
- Satellite modules ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode @bpasero 
  - [x] yo generator @aeschli 
  - [x] vsce @joaomoreno 
  - [x] node debug @weinand 
- [x] Pause scheduled `insider` builds @bpasero 
- When done fixing/verifying
  - [x] Trigger insider build and publish it manually @kieferrm
##### Monday, Jul 4
- US Holiday
- [x] Tag 1.3 build @zurich
- [x] Announce `announce` master is open for business @zurich
- [x] All issues verified
- [x] Acknowledge pull requests in release notes - All 
- [x] Review docs
- Review Docs for coverage of new features. Tracked in Microsoft/vscode-docs#374
##### Tuesday, Jul 5
- [ ] Polish release notes (Redmond)
- [ ] Inbox review #8753
- [x] Publish `Insider` with hand-picked and reviewed candidate fixes
##### Thursday/Friday, Jul 7/8
- [ ] Publish to stable
- [ ] Enable scheduled `insider` builds
### Plan Items

| Mark | Description |
| --- | --- |
| :runner: | work in progress |
| :hand: | task is blocked |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration |
#### Debt Items

This section lists items to reduce our engineering debt:
- [x] Extract the MarkDown editing support into an extension  #6106 @kieferrm
  - [x] Test: Markdown extension , #7945
  - [x] Release Notes
- [x] Extract CSS/LESS/SASS and JSON into an extension @aeschli
  - [x] Test the VS Code CSS/LESS and SCSS Mode, #8212
  - [x] Test the VS Code JSON Mode, #8208
  - [x] Release Notes
- [x] Ensure extension install count is properly updated @joaomoreno
- [x] Monaco Editor - make the CSS/LESS/SASS and JSON language services available in the editor @aeschli
  - [x] CSS/LESS and SCSS in the Monaco editor, #8213
  - [x] JSON in the monaco editor, #8210
  - [x] Release Notes

- [x] Editor - alternative JavaScript grammar

#### Engineering

This section lists several engineering/development items that the team identified:
- [x] Improve in product extension management UI #637 - @joaomoreno

- [x] vsce - add version check to `vsce` and remind user to update to a newer version @joaomoreno 
- [x] Debug - Expand protocol to cover VS scenarios [protocol extensions](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3A%22protocol+extension%22+milestone%3A%22June+2016%22) @weinand 
  - [x] Release Notes
- [x] Surface new debug protocol additions in VS Code @isidorn,  @weinand 
  - Add UI for editing variables #7744 
    - [x] Test setting variable values, #7812
    - [x] Release Notes
  - Show variable type on hover #8040
    - [x] Test 'Variable Type Hover', #8199
    - [x] Release Notes
  - UI support for TimeTravel Debugging #7652

    - [x] Release Notes
#### Explorations
- [x] TypeScript - Explore project level errors/warnings @dbaeumer 
  - [x] Test 'Explore project wide builder for TS', #8203
#### Deferred
- Support to increase the font size used by IntelliSense #2465 
- :hand: TS Adoption - Intellisense on nodejs app files with no extension #7446 
- API - Expose support to edit JSON settings #1396 
- Adopt JSON edit support to update file association settings
- :hand: Linux - Continue to push for code signing #2973 @tyriar  
- Linux - Hygiene work on the packages (names, dependencies, size reduction) @tyriar
## Bugs

Bugs assigned to the current milestone:
- [vscode](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Aupstream+milestone%3A%22June+2016%22)

data.title: JSON: no warning shown when typing setting with invalid casing
data.body: A user was setting `files.autosave` instead of `files.autoSave` but there was no warning generated for doing so.

data.title: Changing the Color Theme breaks Terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.2.0-insider Commit 7ccb21d7e7256a7d42f3dda8b2d3721b8e59724f
- OS Version: Fedora 23

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Terminal
2. Change Color Theme

Terminal is then broken until VSCode is restarted

![anim](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/763861/15823098/7f599b88-2bf9-11e6-83e2-f4bab18fe0de.gif)

data.title: Monaco API request : CommonEditorRegistry
Would like to see errors in explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version:

Since we are rendering a flat list of markers it would be very valuable if we render files that contain an error with an overlay in the explorer. This would allow me to easily spot where in my project problems exists.

data.title: Problems view should allow to scope list to file. Currently on workspace scope is supported.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version:

I would like to scope the problems view to list the errors either per file or per workspace.

data.title: Problem view should show source information
data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version: all

Markers carry a source attribute (e.g eslint, ts,js, ...). If present it should be rendered in the problems view.

data.title: Syntax highlighting broken for PHP
data.body:
- OS Version: Fedora 24

Version 1.2.0-insider
Commit 7ccb21d7e7256a7d42f3dda8b2d3721b8e59724f
Date 2016-05-30T13:06:09.365Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0

For some reason PHP syntax highlighting is broken for me on latest insiders build. I tried switching to different color themes but that didn't change anything. It looks like only PHP is broken. It's correctly detecting it as PHP (it shows in the lower right). All other file types are working fine. I installed any extensions having to do with PHP and nothing worked. Reverting back to the previous Insiders build works. I've attached a view of what I see.

![screenshot from 2016-06-06 11-46-51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1024321/15818294/ec0baebe-2bdc-11e6-9b68-3885e0652605.png)

data.title: Errors in Untitled files stay around
data.body:
1. Create a new Untitled file
2. Type `const hello;` in it
3. Change its mode to JavaScript
4. Close the file, don't save

There is an error laying around in the Problems view

data.title: i can't run as root though i specify an alternate user data directory with the --user-data-dir argument
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.1
- OS Version:ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. sudo code --user-data-dir /home/fregie/.config/Code/
2. It is recommended to start vscode as a normal user. To run as root, you must specify an alternate user data directory with the --user-data-dir argument.

data.title: Letterpress background image in editor area should be SVG
data.body: Noticed it is still using PNG which does not scale nicely when you zoom in:

data.title: Debug: Fix setConfiguration error when name is null or undefined
data.body:
Since https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/559f6505004bee38130cfc44368efad3c5291b09.
When I open a new workspace that contains `launch.json`, and press `F5` to debug. It will show a message that `Please set up the launch configuration file for your application.`

Because current `configurationName` is `null`, so we need use the first configuration in `launch.json`.

data.title: [terminal] (⌘K) was pressed. Waiting for second key of chord...

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0-insider
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press ⌘K to clear the integrated terminal.
2. The terminal gets cleared.
3. *_VS Code is still waiting for the second key of the ⌘K chord._*

⌘K is a recognised shortcut for clearing out the terminal on the Mac, but here it also conflicts with Code's other key bindings.

data.title: show error tips for arrow function in class
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.1
- OS Version:10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. define class extends React.Component
2. input code like

``` javascript
 doLogin = (event) => {
        // ....
    }
```

show error wave line with `doLogin`

data.title: Make prefix sorting in quick open aware of used language

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
バージョン 1.2.0-insider
コミット 7ccb21d7e7256a7d42f3dda8b2d3721b8e59724f

This is purely a usability issue on Japanese localized environment but I think "Install Extension" should be shown first place if we type "install ext" or something.

The problem is that "Show Installed Extensions" is translated as "インストール済みの拡張機能を表示" but "Install Extension" as "拡張機能のインストール" and the order is changed during the translation process...

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311400/15813374/6ab81e20-2bf9-11e6-980e-b981c6677389.png)

data.title: [question] Does editor have API to expose markers?
data.body:
I want to programmatically populate a list of errors from the editor. These markers are present as they are highlighted in the editor, but is there an API that I can call to get all the markers and access these errors/warnings programmatically?

Thanks in advance!

Steps to Reproduce:

data.title: Debug console window formatting : missing leading spaces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Win10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write NodeJS server that uses console.log to logging purposes
2. Format output, I use `JSON.stringify(packet, null, 2)`
3. Start debugging, output will go to "debug console" (in ru_RU translation it is 'консоль отладки')

Problem is that all leading spaces (between line start and formatted text) are missing.
So if I want to see readable JSON structs, I must run server in OS native shell...

data.title: getColumnAtBeginningOfLine cursorHome keybinding behavior

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
`getColumnAtBeginningOfLine` feels very strange to me:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/875e28c7ce42aec6922f45676cc5b7f9a20e5f91/src/vs/editor/common/controller/cursorMoveHelper.ts#L196

The experience is when using keybindings that call `cursorHome` (which calls `getColumnAtBeginningOfLine`), I expect to go to the beginning of the line, but what happens is I end up at the first non-whitespace position OR the beginning, depending on where I last was (it alternates).

To me, this makes certain things more difficult.  For example clean multi-line selection/cut/paste using the keyboard becomes tedious when the selection accidentally starts indented rather than at col 1.
- Is there a simple fix I can just make in my keybindings? **(Preferred, but I couldn't figure out a way)**
- If not, should there be a new "cursorCol1" command or similar?
- Or should the getColumnAtBeginningOfLine just be avoided and always return 1?
- Or is there wisdom behind the way it works that I'm missing?

data.title: Select + Delete causes unexpected selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.5 (El Cap)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a code block
2. Hit backspace fast after completing the selection.

Result:

VSCode goes ahead and carries over the selection to whatever is occupying the same space now. If you wait a little after selection, the problem does not happen.

Sample:

![gif](http://d.ekin.io/17Ge0+)

data.title: [question] windows installer
data.body:
I am sorry to ask this here as it is not really a VSCode issue, but i think it can be useful to the whole Electron community.
My question is how did you manage to have such a small windows installer? 30Mo is really low.
And your executable is only 56Mo. 
In my project my executable is already 80Mo and the installer (squirrel) is 62Mo.
And i already clean most of the node_modules files.

I have looked at the code and couldn't find the win installer build script so i thought i should ask.

Thanks

data.title: Request Feature: Paths mapping support in TypeScript (Intellisense, Errors and Warnings, Go to Definition)
data.body:
This RF is related to TypeScript's **Path mappings based module resolution [#5039 ](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/5039)**.  The link describes all details how Path mapping works. Please review it.

So here is copy of Example 1 from Microsoft/TypeScript#5039

```
projectRoot
├── folder1
│   └── file1.ts (imports 'folder2/file2')
├── folder2
│   ├── file2.ts (imports './file3')
│   └── file3.ts
└── tsconfig.json
```

Expected behavior is to support 'folder2/file' imports without Errors & Warnings, list classes of module and support Intellisense - in short: normal behavior, as it would be, if imported using relative paths.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12189125/15805862/23ed829e-2b47-11e6-902e-8816f443064f.png)

```
export class LocalModuleClass
{
  public title: string = "Title from local-module!!!";
}
```

TypeScript itself, compiles and builds everything as expected, application works.

Here is [demo rep](https://github.com/davidgabrichidze/vscode-paths-example). It uses [angular-cli](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli). Instructions to run app:
`npm install angular-cli -g`
`npm install`
`ng build`
`ng serve`

data.title: TM coloring does not work anymore because path.join and path.normalize have changed
No initial suggestions for the object's keys in autocompletion for JSON (e.g. tsconfig.json)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider Build
- OS Version: Mac OS X

Steps to Reproduce:

When defining a JSON object that VSCode has a schema for, there are no initial suggestions for the Object's keys -- until you type the first character, even if you force-show autocomplete (CTRL+Space). When I'm defining such a JSON file from scratch (e.g. tsconfig.json, .vscode/launch.json, .vscode/settings.json) and I don't remember what other keys it can have defined, it's been driving me nuts as I have been basically manually iterating through "a", "b", "c", "d"... initial letters to see what other keys I might have forgotten about. It seems recently this was [fixed for TypeScript's IntelliSence](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/8525#issuecomment-218081445) recently. 

This is how it **should** work for JSON too:

![5a0074d6-2a52-11e6-9ff4-4a77b2c94134](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/563469/15804791/4e81aecc-2b15-11e6-9a2c-6d8455f9383a.gif)

Autocomplete should show up for the properties even BEFORE we type the first letter, and in case of JSON autocompletion, right after we type the first quote-mark `"`.
